lines.text: I don't belong here, I feel it, don't you think I feel it. I can't do any of these vile things and I wouldn't WANT to. Oh, my life is like death. My children are the spawn of hell, and you're the devil. Oh God.
But baby, we LIKE you.

[Andrew hands Joanna her earrings after they've drank tequila shots below decks with the crew]
You best not lose these again, madam.

[perplexed]
Again?
You will forgive me, madam.
[clearly mocking her]
"Andrew! I seem to have lost my ruby earrings somewhere between 64th and 68th street, find them."

[geniunely contrite]
I've behaved so badly.
[Andrew raises his eyebrows]
You've done all these wonderful things for me and I never even once said thank you.
[beat]
I'm sorry.

[embarrassed]
Apology accepted, ma'am.
[he turns away and to the sink]

[following him]
Everyone on this boat thinks I'm crazy. Do you think they're right?

[turning around to face her]
Oh no, madam. Oh no. You... most of us go through life with blinders on. Knowing only that little station to which we were born. But you madam, have had the... rare privilege of escaping your bonds for just a spell. To see life from an entirely new perspective. How you choose to use that information is entirely up to you.
Mrs. Burbridge, would you come over here for a moment? Has it *escaped your attention* that these children have head to toe poison oak?
Well no, I... well yes, but...

But WHAT? My children are in need of medical assistance! And you can sit here and smugly lecture me on the importance of tests? Tests which exist to pigeonhole childrens potential, a thing which cannot *possibly* be measured, least of all by anal compulsive HUNS! And my husband may be a "large child," but that's none of your business! And my children may be rotten, but they're MINE. And I think that they're bright, and sensitive, so I have no doubts whatsoever about their intelligence. I do however have *serious* doubts about YOURS.

You know what your problem is? You are so goddamn bored, you have to *invent* things to bitch about! You don't have a single thing to do on this earth except for your hair! The closet was fine, you just needed something to fill up your useless, nail-polishing, toe-polishing, rich bitch, sun-tanning days!
[From the engine room, the crew, who have heard all of this, start cheering]

[on her yacht; she's about to call for caviar when Andrew brings it in]
Well! I *almost* had to wait.
[she tastes it and makes a sick face]

What is this gelatinous MUCK? Andrew, when I tell you to pack staples, must I specify that you are to pack *good* caviar and not this $1.99 fish bait? Caviar should be round, and hard, and of adequate size, and should burst in your mouth at *precisely* the right moment.
Tell me something about my life, Dean, something not horrible.

Well uh... yeah, there was that time you were working at Burger Boy, and this kid started choking on a French fry, and everybody in the place panicked, including me, except you, you knew exactly what to do. You ran over to the kid and you gave him that Heimlech, you know,
[grunts]
and puh! The kid puked up the fry and they named you Burger Boy employee of the month. They put your picture above the cash register and everything.
I'm a short, fat slut.
[after Joanna leaves her husband and Dean finds out all the money is hers]
What could I possibly give you... ever... that you don't already have?
A little girl.

[in Pee-Wee Herman's voice]
Hi, Mom. My name's Joe.
A falsetto child?
Nah. He thinks he's Pee-Wee Herman.

[in Pee-Wee Herman's voice]
I love Pee-Wee Herman.
[Pee-Wee's trademark laugh]
[Dean & Billy see Joanna's mugshot on TV]
That's her
Who?
THE BITCH!

[Seeing Grant leaving the hospital on TV]
I can't believe he's skipping out on her
Of course he's skipping out on her, it's his shot at freedom.
Maybe you should go down to the hospital and see if you can get some of your money back?
Look, he's gone.
Not him, her.
She doesn't even know who she is, you think she's gonna know who I am?
[Dean turns around to walk away only to turn right back when he thinks of an idea]
Billy, there is a God and he loves me!
You're not gonna shave your head, are you?
No, i gotta go home and talk to my kids...

[interrupts]
Dean, don't do this
...and I want you to take them shopping at the Salvation Army!
Dean, it's illegal... Dean you're crazy, you know that!
Hey hey hey guys, look who's home
Hi Mom!
Hi Mom!

[in a raspy voice]
Hi Mom!
Gee Mom, we really missed you, we're so glad you're baaaaaack!
[Dean sticks his hand out to tell the boys to stop the dramatics]
They aren't mine...
Oh I was sure you'd remember them!
I think I'd remember if I had 3 children...
...FOUR honey, don't forget little Joe!
[Joe sticks his head out the window and Annie faints after believing she had four sons with Dean]

[brandishing a bow and arrow]
Halt. You treasonous tramp. Conspiring with the enemy at sea is MUTINY.
Pull.
[kicks Grant overboard]

[to Grant]
I am giving my notice, sir.

[to Annie]
I suppose we're on our way back to the jungles of Oregon?
I want to go back, Grant.
To him.
Yes. I'm sorry.
You haven't begun to be sorry, you hillbilly harlot!
I have behaved so badly. You've done so many wonderful things for me and I've never even once said thank you. I'm sorry
Apology accepted, madam.

These gnats keep landing on my wet nail polish. I guess I'm supposed to walk around with their little corpses stuck to my fingers, is that it?... It's easy for you to say. You don't have to sit out here in the brine with your perm frizzing to oblivion. I look like a bushman.

[who's been painting her toenails]
... I've finished, madam. Would you like me to put your jewelry back on you?
No, I'm still tacky.

[on TV]
... If any of you know the identity of this woman
[the amnesiac Joanna]
, please contact the hospital. I'll put up the reward myself... She's drivin' us crazy.
Joanna, what motivated you to rise and get the serving tray?
I thought you might be hungry.
That's excellent, excellent!
What's excellent about it?
I was hungry.
But darling, if you have a baby, you won't be the baby anymore.
You jumped my bones the first night we met!
We did it on the first date?
Couldn't call it a date really, we just did it in the parking lot of the 7-Eleven
I'm a slut
What did you say?
Nothing
Oh, a washing machine! But Dean its so expensive.
No, shit!
Well, the entire civilized world knows that ALL closets are made of CEDAR.

[in a backwoods accent]
Well up here in Elk Snout ma'am see we don't know 'bout them closets, nor bathrooms neither. Shit woman, you're lucky I am house broke.
I'm not a bitch. ANDREW. Are you going to bring me my lemon or do I have to squeeze it from my hat?
[Joanna is about to jump off the yacht and swim to Dean]

[grabs her hand]
Oh no Madam. I cannot let you do this.
What?
Not without a life jacket.
Are you gonna leave?
[the other boys stare]
No, I'm your mommy.
Sometimes moms leave.
Well I suppose that's true, but I'm not going anywhere.
Good.
[takes a necklace out of his overalls and hands it to her]
Ooh! Is this a present for me?
Yes, I did it with macaroni.
I love this, I'll always wear it.
We're at sea, and I'm a GOD at sea!
[to Dr. Korman]
Grant's having another nervous breakdown, he thinks he's God. Keep him busy.
Oh, and give my regards to Schwartzman and Heineken!
Annie, those are my underwear.
Yours?
I don't mean I wear 'em or anything. They belong to a girlfriend of mine.
But what about Gertie?

I strayed. See, I got lucky with this phone sex girl and I found one that takes personal checks; my truck doesn't have a backseat so I borrowed yours. Dean doesn't want you to tell Gertie so he's covering for me.

[comes up to them]
What's going on?
I confess. The jig is up!
The jig IS up, Billy, I'm finally trying to tell her the truth.
I just did. See, I didn't get the name Bad Billy Pratt for nothing. I'm sorry, Annie, I got horny, do you hate me?

[smiles]
No, no
[hugs him]
I'm glad you're Bad Billy Pratt!
It's not us, Dad, it's Roy.

[singing]
Zippedy Doo-Dah. Zippedy Yay. My, oh my, I got a wonderful slave.
What's my name?
Mrs. Annie Proffitt
Well what's my maiden name?
Annie Goolaheey
ANNIE GOOLAHEY... Where in God's name did I grow up, Dogpatch?
No, not there honey over in Goober, Idaho but it's a nuclear waste dump

[aboard her yacht, Joanna is on the phone]
... I KNOW it will cost me, but it's the CUTEST little painting. I simply MUST have it. You'll do the bidding for me at the auction? $1,700,000.
[gunshots]
Grant, I'm on the phone!
I can't hear you, Tea Rose! I'm shooting skeet!
[goes back to firing]

[Grant has just arrived at the hospital; she doesn't know he's right outside, behind a one-way mirror]
... You mean to tell me that I have no medical recourse...?
Can she see us?
Not unless she's got x-ray vision or something.
...Well, what DO you know? Extend your brain a teensy little bit, if possible.
You seem to be suffering from a temporary amnesia...
How TEMPORARY is it?
We don't know. Other than that, you seem to be in excellent physical shape.
Listen to me, medical people. As of now, I have a life history of a DIRTY garbage scow and a breakfast of EXTREMELY RUNNY eggs-over-easy. Now I REFUSE to be INCARCERATED in this semiprivate room -
[turns to the only other patient in the room]
You SNORE! - while there are no efforts being made by anyone to try and locate...!

[to Grant, still outside Joanna's room]
... Is that your wife, sir?
...I DEMAND you do something! Do you hear me...?

[to the Cop]
... No, I never saw her before in my life.
[He leaves; later, back on Joanna's yacht "Immaculata"]
... Mrs. Stayton has decided to leave me. Let's celebrate!
Now, Miss X... we have a safer, more comfortable, private room... where you'll be a lot more comfortable, and we'll all be a lot safer.
Well, I'm glad you've finally come to your senses. I was prepared to sue you. I don't know who I am, but I'm sure I have a lawyer.
Thank you Dean! Thank you for bringing me here and making a wife, and a mother and WHY DID YOU DO THAT?
What're you doing?
I'm turning the boat around.
Why?
I'm going home.
You're turning that wheel around too fast!
It's a helluva day at sea, Sir!
I can't talk to you with you pulled away from me. Will you please get your head out of there and look at me?
No.
Why?

[turns over, covered in Calamie lotion]
Because I'm so ugly, I got poison oak too.
[cries]
Nobody cares what you look like, normally you look really pretty, you just don't now.

[continue sobbing]
I dont even have a wedding ring.
What?
I lost my wedding ring in the sea.
I speak French! Do I know what I said? Yes I do. I must've learned in Paris. When was I in Paris? In the Navy.
You're not leaving me here alone tonight, the kids are sick.
Yeah and they've got Calamie lotion all over them. What do you want me to do?
I want you to take on some of your grownup responsibility.
I earn the money, that's my grownup responsibility.
Are you aware that Joey can't read? And Travis only reads smut magazines? I can never get him out of the bathroom.
Honey he's 13 years old! I'll build you another bathroom.
They don't need another bathroom, they need guidance from you.
Hey hey hey, don't you worry about me and my boys, okay? We're pals.
They have enough pals, they need a father.

[sees his sons gathered in a group whispering excitedly]
What's this?
Travis found a girlfriend.
Hey, Trav, don't knock her up!

[sarcastically]
Very funny!
Can she see us?
Not unless she's Superwoman

[on the other side of the one way window]
Listen to me, medical people!. As of now, I have a light history of a dirty garbage scow and a breakfast of extremely runny eggs over easy. I refuse, REFUSE
[throws an object]
to be incercerated in this semi-private room while there are no efforts being made.
Is that her?
No, I've never seen her before in my life!
I can't believe you did that.
Oh! I saw you jump so I jumped...
No I don't mean that. I can't believe you gave all that up just for me.
I didn't.
What? What do you mean?
Well the truth of the matter is it's all mine, the boat, the money, everything is all mine.
[Dean faints]
Dean! Dean, it's okay!
[the officer at the hospital pulls out the photos and Joanna's panties from a parcel envelope]
Nice panties! J.S., she didn't know what that meant?
See she wouldn't, I bought them for her at a garage sale.
Yeah, I bought my wife a garter at a yard sale once too.
I'm sure you did.
Their making out their Christmas lists
Oh already?
How do you spell Porsche?
Well, they got me thinkin' though what can I possibly give you ever that you don't already have?
A little girl
You're overwrought, Grant. I want you to take a Valium. Here, take one of mine.

[seeing the counterfeit photos that supposedly depict her wedding to Dean, but which are actually just expertly "merged" images which combine her gloomy "amnesia-state" photos with Dean's deceased wife's wedding photos]
But why do I always look so glum and downcast in all of my wedding pictures? Wasn't I happy to marry you?

[thinking fast]
Oh, you were just always kind of a sad person in those days. I didn't mind it, though. You were always good to me, so I loved you just the same.
You know forks were invented so that man could at least make a pretense of separating himself from the apes.
So were thumbs.
What did you say?
Nothing. It was... my stomach.
Well try to control your bodily noises so I can hear myself think.
Are you sure this is gonna work?
My ideas ALWAYS work. I'm gifted.
I loved it when you glued Joey to the toilet seat.
Captain Karl?
Yes madam?
We've never really had time to talk.
No, we haven't.
Well, there's no time now.
You... and the closet.
That's right. This is me and I'm standing in front of the closet.
Something's familiar.
Yeah, well... that's 'cause we used to do it in the closet.
Oh stop with the sex stories.
Is anyone at your home?
Yeah, our mom is.

[dumbfounded]
You boys have a mother now?, your father re-married?
Yeah, we got ourselves a new mom now
Well good, then I'm calling BOTH YOUR PARENTS.

[watching Joanna ride away]
YOU SAID MOMS DON'T LEAVE.

[from her NYC penthouse]
... Joanna, why do you care what some carpenter from Elk Snout thinks of you?
I'm surely just premenstrual.
Then you must go right back to bed for at least two days...
[to her maid, who's been feeding Edith's small dog]
...Inga! You don't shove the food down Shitake's throat. You place it on her tongue. Don't they have dogs in Sweden?

[Dean knocks on the boys' clubhouse door]
Who is it?
Doctor Death, let's go!
We're gonna go get her!
Come on guys! Billy's friends are gonna help us!

[Drunkenly listening to his voice echo into a large vase after Joanna's return]
Tofuuuuuuuti... Tofuuuuti Klein!
Try to understand,Grant, I don't love you anymore.
What's love got to do with marriage?
The best thing the doctor is to do is to take a bath and...
[yells]
GUYS GET THE TURTLE OUT OF THE BATHTUB... and I will look for the pictures first thing in the morning.
I just... ate a bug!
Champagne for everyone.
Andrew, I'd like a beer.
A beer?

[takes a swig from a bottle]
Mmmmm, good stuff.
Joey don't, don't get that near your eye. See it says right here on the bottle, 'don't get it near your eye'.
[Joey throws the bottle away and goes to bed]
What's going on here?
He's upset because he can't read.
Well he's a small child.
He can't read for a small child either.
The teacher makes fun of him.
This one's flat, give me another one Billy!
I only got six.
Well, I guess we better send the ol' ball and chain out to buy us more.
Hey mister, what was I doing out in the ocean?
That's something you like to do, go fishing for oysters at night
Oysters in a cold ocean at night, doesn't sound like me!

[talking in Pee-Wee Herman's voice]
I'm itchy and i want to go home.
You may go stand in the corner until you can talk like a little boy.
Back in the day he was known as Mean Dean Proffitt and me I was Bad Billy Pratt

[Arriving home from his disastrous experience working for the Staytons, he finds Burbridge running out of his house. She is covered with toilet paper and being chased by his dogs]
... You look the morning after Halloween. Probably had a day like I did, what happened to you?

Monday is their first day of school and I came here to WELCOME your family! And WHAT do I get in return? I get TOILET-PAPERED by your children! They were about to douse the toilet paper in GASOLINE and strike - !
Wait. Stop. Greg and Charlie are twins, right?...
[Adele nods]
... They're goin' through this arson period. They don't know this, but I'm way ahead of them. I got two fire extinguishers ready to go. I didn't catch your name?
Adele Burbridge, principal of the Elk Cove School... Your children are MONSTERS!
Oh, you won't think that when you get to know them.
Where is Mrs. Proffitt while all of this is going on?
She died three years ago
Mr. Proffitt, your children are totally lacking in parental supervision!
Hey, you don't have to tell me these kids are lucky.
Fine, you can joke around about it all you want, but if you don't do something, I will notify the proper authorities.
Hey I have had babysitters in here by the dozen, I'm low on cash, I'm new in town but if I have the chance I'll hire a housekeeper!
I'll believe it when I see it, good day Mr. Proffitt!
[drives away]

[yelling]
... I'M A GOOD FATHER!

[on Joanna's yacht, the "Immaculata"]
... Joanna, I want you tonight - How can you have your period EVERY WEEK?

[they're shown in bed together; Grant is glued to "Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous"]
... Must you watch that THING incessantly?
Yes, I must. It has a tawdry, escapist quality that sooths my nerves.
What YOU have to escape from, I can't possibly imagine... Grant, I left my wedding ring on the deck.
Well, what can I do?
Go and get it.
It's after midnight.
I don't care. I want it now.
Let me just see who's in the Top Ten Luxury Yachts. This is the Big League of the Seven Seas, the one purchase that separates mere millionaires from MULTI-millionaires.
[Disgusted, Joanna goes to get it herself]
Hey Billy, who are you talking to?
Nobody!
Hey is that Dean? Hey Dean! Whats going on? Why dont you come in?
Honey, go back to bed.
HOW DARE YOU TREAT ME LIKE THAT! I'M GOING HOME!
Do we have a straight jacket on board?
I always carry one, yes.
Get up, go to the bathroom, do what you normally do.
Will you squirt us with the hose again?
That's up to you.
Look, if it were up to us, we would be glad to give her to you, but she's right we are gonna need some verification.
Are we gonna trade her in for a new mom?
Not if we don't blow it!
[Plays piano and sings]
'I love you madly even though you treat me sadly... '
What's going on here?
We're gonna get Mom back.
We miss her.
Yeah, she cut the crust off the bread.
She doesn't take any of my shit either, I need discipline.
We've got three dollars and four cents.
Yeah, we're gonna go rent a fishing boat and we're gonna get her back.
Well no fishing boat's going to catch a yacht, especially at that price.
Maybe she'll change her mind and come back.
Oh right, doofus, she's on a yacht heading to New York!
This is a job for Dr. Death!
Yeah! Dr. Death could do it!
We've got to do something, *right*, Dad?

[home from work]
Hey guys, what's going on?

[stops playing piano]
I got the part of Tiny Tim in the school play!

[looks up from homework]
I got an A in English!

[looks up from homework]
I'm flunking math.
Yeah well we'll work on the math after dinner.

[teaching Joey to read with comic books]
You're just in time, Dr. Death's on the rampage.

[Annie is near catatonic]
She needs food!
[throws grapes at her, to his brothers]
And this is fun!

[finds Annie near catatonic]
What's wrong with her?
She's been like that for an hour now!
She's getting better though.
Better?
Yeah she's not going
Bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo.
Why'd she do that?
She destroyed the scarecrow, Dad, she ripped that sucker's head off!

[Pee Wee Herman voice]
And now she just goes bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo.

[waves hand in front of her eyes]
Hey, baby doll? What's for dinner?

[distantly]
Bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo-bo.
Alright, I got it from here. Get upstairs.
[picks Annie up]
Dad, you think we should trade her in for a new one?
Nah, she'll be alright.
[takes her out to the rain barrel and dunks her in]
